background_description: The background consists of dry, earthy soil mixed with numerous small, irregularly shaped gravel stones of varying shades of brown, gray, and tan. Sparse blades of green and dried grass are also scattered throughout the ground.
camouflage_type: Color blending / Pattern matching / Shape disruption
explanation: The toad exhibits excellent camouflage in this image. Its mottled brown and grey coloration, with darker spots and lighter patches, perfectly mimics the diverse hues and irregular patterns of the gravel and soil background. The rough, warty texture of its skin also blends seamlessly with the granular texture of the small stones, contributing to the overall visual 'noise' that conceals its form. The low contrast difference between the toad's patterned skin and its surroundings, combined with the shape disruption created by these patterns, makes it very difficult to distinguish its outline from the environment.
